column1: Polevskoy (Russian: Полевско́й) is a town in Sverdlovsk Oblast
column3: located 50 kilometers (31 mi) southwest of Yekaterinburg
column4: the administrative center of the oblast. Population: 64

column1: The town is best known for its Dumnaya Mountain
column2: where a monument to those who died fighting Kolchak's army is located. The mountain and its surroundings are also mentioned in many tales by Pavel Bazhov.

column1: The town was founded in the first quarter of the 18th century as a settlement around copper mines. The first mine was established in 1702 and the commercial development started in 1718. In 1724–1727
column2: the Polevskoy Copper Smelting Plant was built to process the copper.

column1: The modern town comprises the territories of former settlements of Gumeshki
The flag of Polevskoy consists of the Venus symbol (♀)
column2: which represents the chemical element copper
column3: the character Lizard Queen of Russian folklore
column4: the symbolic representation of the Stone Flower from the story of the same name
column6: the brand of the Seversky Pipe Plant.

column1: Within the framework of the administrative divisions
column4: incorporated as the Town of Polevskoy—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the Town of Polevskoy is incorporated as Polevskoy Urban Okrug.

column1: The bandy team Seversky Trubnik plays in a recreational league.
